A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: The film constantly reminds me to let the past die while offering me nothing better in return. It feels like a purposely contrarian film\, full of “subversive” things just for the sake of it. The film does nothing to expound upon anything introduced in The Force Awakens while simultaneously disrespecting the original trilogy’s characters. The tone is so unbalanced and the forced humor is misplaced and undercutting. Plot holes in abundance as well as huge details that flip everything we knew about Star Wars on its head - not in a positive way. Having said this - there are positives. There’s a few very touching sequences between characters and some really neat action sequences. The cinematography is gorgeous and it’s nice they’re continuing to utilize as much in the way of hand built sets\, puppets\, animatronics\, and practical effects as possible. John Williams also does a good job with the film\, but I wasn’t left remembering any new pieces of music that will become iconic. I really don’t know what they’re going to do with Episode 9\, but part of me is honestly apathetic now because of what this film made me feel. We’ll see\, in time\, I guess.
